question:
Competitive SIS model over two multiplex layer A and B same set of nodes. the two memes are exclusive: A node cannot adopt meme 1 and meme 2 simultaneously. Beta 1 and delta 1 for layer 1 and beta2 and delta 2 for layer 2 Assume the effective adoption rates of each meme are larger than their no-sharing mean field threshold, i.e., ðœ1>1/ðœ†1(ð´) and ðœ2>1/ðœ†1(ðµ).Question1-:  Will both memes survive (coexistence), or will one meme completely remove the other (absolute dominance)?2-which characteristics of a multilayer network structure allow for coexistence?
 This question need to be addressed analytically and then simulated to see if the analytical solutions are also valid by simualtion comprehensively.
 please do not ask the user any question, use other tools to address the question
next_plan:
Completed Discovery and initial Modeling: gathered literature, identified SI1SI2S competitive model, built representative multiplex network layers (Erdos-Renyi for meme1, Barabasi-Albert for meme2), computed spectral radii and degree moments.
Next steps:
1. Finalize mechanistic model definition in FastGEMF, set parameters (beta, delta) consistent with given tau>1/lambda.
2. Define initial conditions and write simulation code (simulation-11.py) to run multiple stochastic realizations, save results-11.csv and results-11.png.
3. Execute simulations.
4. Analyze CSV results: compute prevalence curves, final sizes, dominance or coexistence metrics.
5. Extend analysis varying overlap of central nodes to test coexistence condition; run second simulation with layers highly correlated (identical) to show dominance (simulation-12).
6. Produce LaTeX report including analytic derivations and simulation outcomes.
Continue in next iteration.
